definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Sadly, Dad passed away this past January.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，家父已於今年一月往生。

sentences.english: My father abused us for years.
I had consult my father (a professional tourism marketer and absolute authority in the industry around Yangtze river country) and my intelligence in Nanking for several times.
sentences.chinese: 我與家父和我在南京的情報人員進行了多次商討諮詢。

sentences.english: Your Majesty, this is Qing's own idea. My father knows nothing about it.
sentences.chinese: 稟皇上，是青女自己的心意，與家父無關。

sentences.english: Joking aside, my father also noticed another interesting facet to the evening.
sentences.chinese: 言歸正傳，家父也發現了有趣的另一面。

sentences.english: My father always favors my little brother.
My father went to see this bandleader.
sentences.chinese: 於是家父去見樂隊負責人。

sentences.english: My father always gave an ear to my problems.
sentences.chinese: 家父經常傾聽我的問題。

sentences.english: The trouble is that my father is ill in bed.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩的是家父正臥病在牀。

sentences.english: Again , that book was my fathers short stories compiled into a book.
sentences.chinese: 再一次，是用家父的故事結集成書，這是第二本書。

definition: uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
father's elder brother/term of respect for older man/CL:個|个[ge4]
